job description:
The
primary objective of this position is to serve as either lead or support
analyst on project requests as submitted by internal and external clients. This
requires independent and team-based work across multiple lines of business
while utilizing a range of analytical techniques and tools. All members
of Data Analytics enjoy working with some of the most diverse global data sets,
cutting edge technology, and the ability to see data insights turned into real
business results on a regular basis.

The Data
Analyst / Behavioral Analyst position requires professional and technical
experience in a multidisciplinary set of data sciences to lead individual and
organizational development of primary initiatives. This position may also
require partnership with other key internal/external business and IT personnel
to promote the effective and efficient use of analytical tools and resources.
These tools and resources will be utilized in managing customer interactions,
increasing market share, communicating and enhancing competitive advantages,
and maximizing revenue and/or profits while reducing costs across all lines of
business within Assurant.

Operations Execution
– 70&
  • Analyze
    effectiveness of analytical products and services to constantly improve tools,
    procedures, and workflows that minimize risk and enhance customer
    experience
  • Transform
    data into insights through leveraging internal and external tools (e.g.,
    R, SAS, Python, SQL, Hadoop, Excel, Sawtooth, CART, etc.) to identify
    and quantify opportunities
  • Partial
    Management of data and data requests to improve the accuracy of
    decision-making and efficiency of resources, personnel and data
Effective Communication -20"
  • Understands
    the business’ opportunities to hypothesize as an individual
    researcher and in collaboration with other team members
    in identifying the optimal business solution
  • Produces
    clear, insightful, understandable work products (visualizations, reports,
    presentations, etc.) to outline business opportunities and actionable
    recommendations internally and externally
  • Effectively
    partner with I/T, Account Management, Operations, Digital, Finance,
    Marketing and others to communicate findings from team’s analytical
    insights, design tests and incorporate recommendations into business
    processes
  • Collaborates
    with Behavioral Analytics team members to prioritizes requests requiring
    multiple resources for thorough project completion within stated timelines
  • May
    participate in the talent acquisition process by screening and
    interviewing candidates at all levels
Strategy Development
– 10&
  • Build
    strategic insights and planning function that not only executes various
    projects and studies but also adds substantial value to the
    decision-making process through proactive data analysis, reporting, and
    research
  • Work
    cross-functionally with business owners to develop innovative advanced
    analytics products that will increase customer experience, capitalize
    growth opportunities, deliver competitive advantage and improve decision
    making
  • Participate
    and drive data modeling and governance best practices.
  • Partial
    project management operations in order to drive all aspects of projects
    including: understanding business requirements from stakeholders,
    independently formulating analysis approach and creating hypothesis,
    identifying required data, preparing data for analysis, testing
    hypothesis, conducting analysis, presenting complex information for
    various audiences in simplified terms, and identifying next steps and
    future opportunity
  • Remains
    abreast of developments in the field(s) of insurance, management, and data
    sciences by attending self-development programs, interacting with peers,
    and reviewing pertinent literature. Incorporates advancements when
    practicable and cost effective.

Basic Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s
    Degree in Statistics, Economics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or
    Information Management
  • 2 years
    of experience in business analysis, research, statistics, applied
    mathematics, data management, business intelligence, or related fields
  • 2 years
    of working experience with data science tools (e.g., R, SAS, Python,
    SQL, Hadoop, Advanced Excel, Tableau, PowerBI, Sawtooth, CART, etc…) and
    relational database software
  • 2 years
    of experience in data analysis that includes translating insights into
    recommendations
  • Effective
    presentation and communication skills
  • Ability
    to travel at least once per quarter (10
    )
